items.title: Jim Cramer On The Boeing Company (BA) – “Planes Will Get More Expensive – How Would Boeing Handle It? I Have No Idea”
items.description: We recently published a list of What Did Jim Cramer Say About These 19 Stocks Recently? In this article, we are going to take a look at where The Boeing Company (NYSE:BA) stands against other stocks that Jim Cramer discussed recently. Jim Cramer kicked off his latest episode of Mad Money by highlighting the wild […]

items.title: The Air Force Asked L3Harris: Can You Build Us a Fighter Plane for Less Than $50 Million?
items.author: The Motley Fool
items.description: The U.S. Air Force awarded L3Harris a $3 billion contract to deliver 75 modified Air Tractor AT-802U Sky Warden turboprop aircraft, which will cost less than $50 million per plane. The new 'Skyraider II' planes are designed for close air support and reconnaissance missions, and have attracted interest from over 20 potential overseas buyers.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: L3Harris won a $3 billion contract from the U.S. Air Force to deliver 75 modified turboprop aircraft, which are expected to cost less than $50 million per plane. The new 'Skyraider II' planes have also attracted interest from over 20 potential overseas buyers, indicating a potential expansion opportunity for L3Harris.

The article mentions Lockheed Martin as a major defense contractor that builds fighter planes, but does not provide any specific information about the company's involvement in the Skyraider II program.
